definition: to put one's hand to it/to start out on a task/to set out
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
think of the big picture, start with the little things (idiom)
pinyin: da4 chu4 zhuo2 yan3 , xiao3 chu4 zhuo2 shou3

definition: empty-handed
with one's hands clasped behind one's back
lit. set out and it becomes spring (idiom); to effect a miracle cure (of medical operation)/to bring back the dead/once it starts, everything goes well

sentences.english: There are two ways to solve supply and demand contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 解决供需矛盾可从两个方面着手，首先是减少需求。

sentences.english: So he began experimenting with liquids.
Well, you're not coming empty-handed, are you?
sentences.chinese: 天啊，你总不会空着手来，是吧。

sentences.english: News companies should be prepared with a mobile-first strategy.
sentences.chinese: 新闻企业应该着手“移动先行”战略。

sentences.english: With a faery, hand in hand.
Submit the plan book to SD 15days before the activity starts.
sentences.chinese: 告知社团着手设计活动策划书。

sentences.english: The young worker found a lot of shortcomings in himself and he set about getting rid of it.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年工人发现身上有不少缺点，就着手进行改正。

sentences.english: And the dangerous offense is a type of criminal attempt.
sentences.chinese: 着手实行是犯罪预备与犯罪未遂的关节点。

sentences.english: He assures Andre that he will soon get to Teri and Kim.
sentences.chinese: 他叫安德烈放心，他马上会着手“解决”泰瑞和金姆。

sentences.english: Finally, establishing the international cooperation mechanism of anti-network spy.
sentences.chinese: 最后着手建立防控网络间谍窃密的国际合作机制。

sentences.english: Audio has been reported as "Tinny" - we are looking in to this.
sentences.chinese: 有报告称声音很小，我们正着手解决这个问题。

sentences.english: This time, we are going to work on finishing our Tic-Tac-Toe program.
sentences.chinese: 此次，我们将要着手完成我们的井字过三关程序。

sentences.english: In other words, go small and learn.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，去小处着手，边干边学。

sentences.english: We will tackle this difficult problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们将着手解决这个难题。

sentences.english: We just have different angles of attack on this general problem.
sentences.chinese: 只是对这一普遍的问题有不同的着手点。

sentences.english: Iceland has already begun constructing a hydrogen grid using plentiful geothermal energy.
sentences.chinese: 冰岛已经着手建设一座利用丰富地热能源的氢气站。

definition: to intensify/to speed up/to step up
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to begin/beginning/to start/initial/CL:個|个[ge4]
preparations/to get ready for sth
to begin/to set one's hand to
the next step
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
just at (that time)/right in (that place)/right in the middle of (doing sth)
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
top priority job/matter of vital importance
a skill/mastery of a trade/by oneself/without outside help
countermeasure for dealing with a situation
to plan/to intend/to calculate/plan/intention/calculation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to finish/to end/to complete
to turn to (sth else)/to switch to
